intro: Oenothera rydbergii, commonly known as Rydberg's evening primrose, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers emit a strong scent at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Oenothera rydbergii is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its resilience to drought.
